page.title: 09The Church in East Brent
page.content: East Brent has a church known as St. Mary's. It has a spire which was once painted white as a guide to boats. The door is very old and has a very heavy iron ring and handle. All the bench ends are carved and decorated, each one different.One has the initials of Abbot Selwood who had built a house in East Brent. There are 2 stone statues of priests about 600 years old and another lies in the church yard. The ceiling is of decorated plaster. In the churchyard is a stone cross believed to be 15th century. It was restored in the 19th century as a tribute to Archdeacon Denison, a vicar of East Brent in the late 19th century.
